documentation.text:
@dev The PoolTokensContainer contract serves as a container for multiple pool tokens.
 It is used by specific liquidity pool types that require more than a single pool token,
 while still maintaining the single converter / anchor relationship.
 It maintains and provides a list of the underlying pool tokens.

@dev returns the list of pool tokens
 @return list of pool tokens

@dev creates a new pool token and adds it to the list
 @return new pool token address

@dev The PoolTokensContainer contract serves as a container for multiple pool tokens.
 It is used by specific liquidity pool types that require more than a single pool token,
 while still maintaining the single converter / anchor relationship.
 It maintains and provides a list of the underlying pool tokens.

@dev returns the list of pool tokens
 @return list of pool tokens

@dev creates a new pool token and adds it to the list
 @return new pool token address

devdoc.details: The PoolTokensContainer contract serves as a container for multiple pool tokens. It is used by specific liquidity pool types that require more than a single pool token, while still maintaining the single converter / anchor relationship. It maintains and provides a list of the underlying pool tokens.

acceptOwnership().details: used by a new owner to accept an ownership transfer

burn(address,address,uint256).details: removes tokens from the given account and decreases the pool token supply can only be called by the contract owner

params._from: account to remove the tokens from

params._decimals: used for the underlying pool token decimals
params._name: pool name, also used as a prefix for the underlying pool token names
params._symbol: pool symbol, also used as a prefix for the underlying pool token symbols

createToken().details: creates a new pool token and adds it to the list

mint(address,address,uint256).details: increases the pool token supply and sends the new tokens to the given account can only be called by the contract owner

params._to: account to receive the newly minted tokens

poolTokens().details: returns the list of pool tokens

transferOwnership(address).details: allows transferring the contract ownership the new owner still needs to accept the transfer can only be called by the contract owner

withdrawTokens(address,address,uint256).details: withdraws tokens held by the contract and sends them to an account can only be called by the owner

params._to: account to receive the new amount
